image.altText: A graphic including a newspaper front page, image of von Einem in sunglasses and an inset photo of victim Richard Kelvin

props.synopsis: One of South Australia's most notorious murderers was this week rushed to an infirmary on the brink of death, prompting recollections of the time when young males disappeared across Adelaide in a set of gruesome crimes dubbed "The Family" murders. Warning: This story contains details some readers may find distressing.

title.children: 'The Family' murders which stole Adelaide's innocence

image.altText: William Barratt 1880 first mormon

props.synopsis: It's been 185 years this month since Australia's first Mormon arrived in Adelaide. He immediately regretted the move.

title.children: Australia's first Mormon warned others of Adelaide's wickedness

image.altText: Hundreds of flies gather on a feeding area.

props.synopsis: Researchers on Kangaroo Island have been breeding and releasing millions of sterile Australian sheep blowflies in an attempt to eradicate the pest.

title.children: Sterile flies take to the sky in Kangaroo Island eradication push

image.altText: An 80-year-old woman looking straight into the camera.

props.synopsis: Decades on from Australia's forced adoption era, just two states have set up a redress scheme for the mothers who were harmed. Survivors are calling for South Australia to take similar action — warning time is running out.

title.children: Jo had her baby 'ripped away' at birth — she's one of thousands across Australia

image.altText: A colourful Supercar is stationary on a race course with a checkered flag overhead and full crowd watching

props.synopsis: Supercars championship leader Broc Feeney overcomes engine dramas to take victory in the penultimate Adelaide grand final race.

title.children: Feeney and Mostert set for blockbuster Supercars finale in Adelaide

image.altText: The Elizabeth City Centre shopping centre during a lockdown.

props.synopsis: A teenage boy is in hospital with life-threatening injuries after a stabbing at an Adelaide shopping centre in which a 20-year-old man was also injured.

title.children: Teens arrested over shopping centre stabbing that leaves two in hospital

image.altText: Two people outside a Bedford site.

props.synopsis: Former Bedford staff have said they are owed millions of dollars in entitlements after they were made redundant when the disability employment provider entered voluntary administration earlier this year.

title.children: Terminated Bedford staff in limbo, with millions owed in entitlements

image.altText: A collage of images including missing boy Gus Lamont.

props.synopsis: The disappearance of Gus Lamont is one of those events that have a seismic impact on public consciousness: they distress, disturb, upset and unsettle. This week six mine shafts were searched, providing no further clues in the case.

title.children: Gus has been gone for 63 days, and multiple searches have yielded no clues

image.altText: Young blonde girl in an outcrop of rocks.

props.synopsis: Renowned Australian director Peter Weir gives a rare behind-the-scenes insight into what made Picnic at Hanging Rock such a memorable and enduring film.

title.children: How Peter Weir captured a 'golden glow' in Picnic at Hanging Rock

image.altText: A person with long hair stands barefoot on a path surrounded by green edible plants.

props.synopsis: Leaving my garden in the heat of summer can feel worrying but some simple planning means it misses me less than I miss it.

title.children: When I leave my garden in summer, this is what I do so it survives

image.altText: Officer holds up large bag of drugs at police headquarters

props.synopsis: Police say a man has been charged for allegedly carrying $2.75 million worth of illicit drugs while travelling on a bus from Melbourne to Adelaide overnight.

title.children: Man allegedly travelled with $2.75m drug haul on bus from Melbourne to Adelaide

image.altText: Two men amid bushes in a sandy area stand next to drilling equipment.

props.synopsis: Infrastructure to monitor the impact of rising sea levels and storm surges on the Coorong in South Australia has been installed along the thin strip of coastline between Goolwa Beach and the lagoons of the Ramsar-listed wetland.

title.children: Scientist drills into dunes to collect storm surge data at renowned wetland

image.altText: A man with a beard and grey hair on an old boat

props.synopsis: A coroner has found Anthony Higgins, who went missing in 2020 sparking the largest and most expensive marine search in South Australian waters, died two weeks later when he went missing again.

title.children: Boatie who went missing twice died from 'exposure to the sea'

image.altText: Broken down on the Birdsville Track

props.synopsis: The ABC's Landline crew discovers extreme kindness with a can-do attitude after a mechanical breakdown in South Australia's outback.

title.children: Broken down on the Birdsville Track in search of a cattle-carrying boat

image.altText: Sea foam on a pavement next to the beach with a cyclist riding by

props.synopsis: Authorities say metropolitan testing shows Karenia algal levels remain low compared with last month, despite thick foam and fish deaths seen on some beaches in recent days.

title.children: Dead fish, foam seen on metro beaches despite overall low algal levels

image.altText: An older, bearded man in a dark suit leans on a stone pillar outside a grand old building.

props.synopsis: Leon Bignell has announced he will retire from politics at the next state election bringing an end to his 20-year reign as the MP for Mawson.

title.children: SA house speaker joins departing MPs ahead of March election

image.altText: Girl holding up mobile phone with boarding house sign behind her

props.synopsis: Regional and remote students are being encouraged to learn old-school ways to stay in contact as social media bans for those under 16 come into effect over the summer holidays.

title.children: What the social media ban means for rural boarding school students

image.altText: A woman in a red top and jeans standing next to a large scale machine with rolls of paper inside it.

props.synopsis: With Broken Hill's Barrier Truth newspaper in the process of selling off its usable assets, some wonder if its still-working press would be more valuable as scrap or even a museum piece.

title.children: Outback printing press faces scrap or museum as Barrier Truth winds down

image.altText: Green chardonnay grapes sit on vines in bunches.

props.synopsis: The wine grape industry has written to the SA government pleading for help as it reaches breaking point after indicative pricing for the next vintage is released showing growers could face losses of up to $270 per tonne.

title.children: White wine grape growers already in crisis suffer 'another kick in the guts'

image.altText: Honeybees on a frame, beekeeper points a finger at the queen bee.

props.synopsis: Beekeepers are being urged to monitor their hives more frequently after further detections of the deadly bee parasite varroa mite in South Australia.

title.children: Varroa mite detected in bee hives in two more SA locations

image.altText: Mia King, wearing a hoodie, smiles as she is hugged by North Melbourne teammates after they won the AFLW grand final.

props.synopsis: During their AFLW premiership celebrations, North Melbourne players make sure to take time for Mia King, who just missed the grand final with a knee injury.

title.children: Emotional scenes as AFLW premiers rush to embrace sidelined star after GF

image.altText: A man wearing a hi-viz vest and hard hat walks towards batteries with Tesla written on them

props.synopsis: One of Australia's largest battery energy storage systems would be built on farmland in South Australia's south-east in a proposal that the developer says will lower electricity costs.

title.children: Concerns SA's 'best agricultural land' being taken up by battery projects

image.altText: One woman wearing a yellow t-shirt and one woman wearing a pink t-shirt smile at the camera.

props.synopsis: As the crypto sector expands its appeal beyond tech insiders, the gamification of cryptocurrencies is appealing to younger users, which experts warn is walking the line between gaming and gambling.

title.children: The crypto crazes walking the line between gaming and gambling

image.altText: A close up of Donald Trump wearing a suit and red tie.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump says the entire airspace above the South American nation of Venezuela should be considered closed in its entirety.

title.children: Trump says airspace above and surrounding Venezuela to be closed

image.altText: McLaren F1 driver Oscar Piastri puts his hand on his head, wearing a cap, as he smiles after qualifying at the Qatar Grand Prix.

props.synopsis: Australian driver Oscar Piastri is doing everything he can to catch McLaren teammate Lando Norris in the world championship race, winning the sprint race and qualifying in pole position for the Qatar Grand Prix.

title.children: Piastri's perfect day sees him edge closer to teammate in F1 championship

image.altText: Debris and rubbish piled into the street

props.synopsis: Thailand’s Health Ministry estimates that more than 160 people were killed in the disaster across nine provinces, but at least 110 of those died in Songkhla, where Hat Yai is the capital.

title.children: Growing public backlash as flooded Thai communities ask 'where is the government?'

image.altText: Three men in suits and ties and a woman sit at a table.

props.synopsis: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio and special envoy Steve Witkoff will meet with Ukrainian negotiators in Florida for talks on a deal to end Russia's war in Ukraine, a senior US official says.

title.children: Rubio, Witkoff to meet Ukraine delegation, US official says

image.altText: The tail of a Jetstar aircraft showing its name an livery

props.synopsis: About 90 Jetstar flights have been cancelled across Australia today due to a global recall of Airbus A320 planes for urgent software repairs.

title.children: Global recall of Airbus A320s throws world's airlines into disarray

image.altText: People throw hands in air partying

props.synopsis: With countries like Australia still debating whether or not the time has come to become a republic, what prompted tiny Barbados with its population of less than 300,000, to take the leap?

title.children: Why tiny Barbados said goodbye to the royal family

image.altText: Tom Gleeson on the set of Hard Quiz gesturing behind him with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: I'm not going to stop you from trying, but it might be worth readjusting your expectations. Let's play, HARD!

title.children: Think you'll nail this week's Hard Quiz? Cute

image.altText: A man sits at a table while a monster with red eyes looks over his shoulder

props.synopsis: First Nations stories are combined with modern horror scares in this new film from Australian creatives Chris Broadbent and Enzo Tedeschi.

title.children: First Nations horror movie scares a resurgent BIFF

image.altText: Map of Sunda and Sahul, with arrows showing potential migration routes.

props.synopsis: A new genetic study has found Indigenous Australians travelled via two distinct routes 60,000 years ago to reach the ancient landmass that would become Australia.

title.children: DNA study provides 'almost perfect correlation' for first Australians' arrival

image.altText: Blue Wiggle Anthony dancing in the background with musician Keli Holiday at the front

props.synopsis: A spokesperson for the group says the band "does not condone" the use of drugs after a since-deleted video promoting Keli Holiday's single, Ecstasy, appeared on social media.

title.children: Wiggles issue statement after appearing in Keli Holiday Ecstasy video

image.altText: A woman wearing a swimsuit in the ocean with a CGM scanner visible on her stomach.

props.synopsis: We spoke to six people with three different types of diabetes to find out what they wish more of the public knew. Here's what they had to say.

title.children: The things people with diabetes want you to be aware of
